sub_events.title: Logical Quiz
rules: 20 questions in the game.
Each question is displayed for 60 seconds.
2 members per team.
No electronic gadgets are allowed, if used disqualified.
Each question should have only 1 answer, if more than 1 answer is written the answer is invalid.

sub_events.title: Code Relay
rules: 2 members per team.
Each team is given one problem.
5 minutes to solve the question.
Participants can choose any programming language convenient to them.
1st person is given 2.5 minutes. Once the member's time ends, they must stop immediately and hand over to the next member.
Only one member is allowed to code at a time.
Time limit will be strictly followed, the program must be completed within the given time.
In case of tie, code efficiency and correctness will be considered.

events.title: Tech Nova
events.description: Tech Puzzle is a technical event designed to evaluate participants' logical reasoning, programming fundamentals, aptitude, and problem-solving skills through structured rounds.

rounds.title: Round 1: Logical & Pattern Puzzles
rounds.description: Logical reasoning, number series, and pattern-based puzzles.

rounds.title: Round 2: Technical Basics & Binary
rounds.description: Computer fundamentals, binary decoding, and basic technical questions.

rounds.title: Round 3: Programming Logic & Debugging
rounds.description: Predicting outputs, identifying errors, and applying coding logic.

rounds.title: Round 4: Final Puzzle Challenge
rounds.description: Rapid puzzle round for shortlisted teams to decide winners.

rules: Participation is individual or in teams of 2â€“3 members.
Mobile phones and electronic gadgets are strictly prohibited.
Each round has a fixed time limit.
Evaluation is based on accuracy and speed.
Teams may be eliminated after each round.
Any malpractice will result in disqualification.
Judges' and coordinators' decisions are final.

events.title: Paper Jam
topics: Future of Jobs in the Digital World
Internet of Things (IoT) in Smart Homes
Entrepreneurship and Startup Culture in India
rules: Open to all departments within the college (UG & PG students).
Participation can be individual or in a team of up to 2 members.
Each team can submit one original paper.
Presentation time: Maximum 5 minutes (including Q&A).
Presentation must be in PPT format (Minimum 10 Slides) and it should be upload prior to the deadline.
Presentation language: English.
Plagiarism is strictly prohibited.
Participants must carry a college ID card.
Judges' decision will be final.
Participation and merit certificates will be provided.
